info.title: Action1 API
info.description: This specification defines Action1 RESTful API for integrations. With this API, you can query managed endpoints, list vulnerabilities and missing updates, generate reports, create and launch automations and more. Use this API to integrate your applications with Action1. For simplified API scripting experience, we recommend using [PSAction1](https://www.action1.com/psaction1/)

tags.name: OAuth 2.0
tags.description: Authorize API calls with API credentials (Client ID and Client Secret) generated in Action1 console. After executing the authentication request, extract the 'access_token' from its response and pass it as a header ('Authorization: Bearer access_token') in every subsequent API call. If you use this API documentation system to interact with the API, click the Authorize button at the top, and provide the Client ID and Client Secret to generate tokens automatically.

tags.name: Search
tags.description: The search function allows to quickly locate reports, endpoints, and App Store apps. Note that search returns only basic details about objects. To find out more, retrieve each object individually.

tags.name: Endpoints
tags.description: The endpoint object represents a server, workstation, or other device managed by Action1 within a specific organization. Endpoints can only belong to one Action1 organization at one time, but can be moved between organizations.

tags.name: Endpoints. Endpoint Group Management
tags.description: Endpoint groups organize endpoints within an organization.

tags.name: Endpoints. Remote Sessions.
tags.description: Action1 enables users to leverage remote desktop capabilities and manage endpoints remotely.

tags.name: Endpoints. Agent Deployment
tags.description: The Action1 Agent Deployment feature enables you to discover endpoints in your corporate network and connect them to Action1 Cloud.

tags.name: Endpoints. Deployers
tags.description: The Action1 Deployer service runs in your corporate network and orchestrates Action1 agent deployment based on criteria set in the Agent Deployment configuration.

tags.name: Data Sources
tags.description: A data source is a scripting template that queries certain endpoint data, such as disk volume or local group members, and presents it in a structured way consumed by reports or alerts. Data sources can be built-in or custom (defined by 'builtin' parameter). Built-in data sources are maintained by Action1 and cannot be modified. Custom data sources can be created and maintained by the user.

tags.name: Script Library
tags.description: The Script Library contains ready-to-use PowerShell and CMD scripts that you can leverage when configuring new automations. Built-in scripts are maintained by Action1 and cannot be modified. Custom scripts are created and maintained by the user.

tags.name: Advanced Settings
tags.description: With advanced settings, you can fine-tune Action1 features. New settings are created based on built-in setting templates and are applied to a certain scope such as a group, an organization, or the entire enterprise.

tags.name: Reports. Report Definition Objects
tags.description: Reports bring insights into your IT assets, endpoint configuration, etc. Built-in reports are organized into categories and are maintained by Action1. Report and category IDs are unique across the entire Action1 Cloud, except for custom reports. Along with built-in reports, Action1 enables users to create custom reports based on built-in or custom data sources (to see available data sources use 'GET /data-sources/{orgId}'). Custom reports are stored within the custom category. The API methods described in this section operate on report definitions (and not endpoint data retrieval).

tags.name: Reports. Report Data
tags.description: Generate reports to get data from your remote endpoints. The API methods described in this section retrieve report data rows.

tags.name: Software Repository
tags.description: Action1 Software Repository is a continuously updated private application repository that hosts the latest versions of all supported applications to keep your endpoints secure and patched. Action1 maintains built-in software repository packages that are available to all customers as well as enables users to create private software packages to be shared within their organizations only. The package object is a container of software versions and initially, it should contain the first available version of the software (child object called "version"). New versions are added continuously as the respective vendor releases them. Each version object contains the software binary setup files in MSI, EXE or ZIP format (up to 32Gb in size) and deployment settings, such as silent install switches. It may also include the additional actions to be executed before or after a software installation or uninstallation (e.g., reboot or run a script).

tags.name: Software Repository. Upload Installation File
tags.description: Action1 supports resumable multi-chunk file upload so the client can upload extra-large, multi-gigabyte files.

tags.name: Software Deployment. Updates (Patches)
tags.description: Action1 automatically keeps track of updates for third-party applications and operating systems.

tags.name: Software Deployment. Installed Software Inventory
tags.description: With Action1, you can create a comprehensive IT asset inventory, keep track of the installed applications, and automatically collect all hardware details.

tags.name: Automations. Schedules
tags.description: Action1 implements automation-based endpoint management. The AutomationSchedule object consists of actions (what to run: run script, deploy updates, etc), scope (where to run: list of endpoints or groups), and schedule (when to run).

tags.name: Automations. Instances
tags.description: The AutomationInstance object is created every time a automation is executed on schedule. It contains a list of endpoints where actions are applied as well as other execution details.

tags.name: Automations. Action Templates
tags.description: Action templates define actions available for usage in the endpoint management automations.

tags.name: Diagnostic Logging
tags.description: Logs give you insights into product operations and help ensure your remote endpoints are properly managed.

tags.name: Subscription
tags.description: View Action licenses, start or extend a free trial, or request a price quote.

tags.name: Subscription. Calculating Usage Statistics
tags.description: Monitor how Action1 resources are utilized across your organizations or an entire enterprise.

tags.name: Security. Users Management
tags.description: Manage users who have access to your enterprise.

tags.name: Security. Enterprise Object
tags.description: The Enterprise contains all of your organizations, Action1 users, and their roles.

tags.name: Security. Organization Object
tags.description: The organization represents a smaller subset of remote endpoints such as a department within a large company or an MSP client. Each oganization is isolated from all other organizations in the same enterprise. Action1 enables you to grant access within the organization's scope to automations, actions, reports, etc.

tags.name: Security. Role-Based Access Control
tags.description: Action1 uses role-based access control (RBAC) to manage user access to resources.

tags.name: Report Subscriptions
tags.description: Report subscriptions allow receiving scheduled email reports. This API currently supports only these two report IDs "weekly_patch_statistics" and "daily_patch_statistics".

tags.name: Vulnerability Management
tags.description: Access to real-time vulnerability scanning information about all vulnerable software installed on the managed endpoints. This includes details about Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) and documentation regarding the compensating controls that have been applied.

tags.name: Audit Trail
tags.description: Access to audit log for tracking of user activities and configuration changes.

post.summary: Requests a new OAuth token to be used in all other API calls
post.description: Generates a token. Provide valid API credentials (Client ID and Client Secret) which are configured in API credentials page in Action1 console.

client_id.description: The Client ID generated using the API Credentials section in Action1.

client_secret.description: The Client Secret generated using the API Credentials section in Action1.

client_id.description: The Client ID generated using the API Credentials section in Action1.

refresh_token.description: The Refresh Token generated after successful authorization.

200.description: Returns an OAuth object.

get.description: Gets a list of organizations within the current Action1 enterprise.

200.description: Returns a ResultPage object with Organization objects.

post.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_organizations`**

Creates a new organization. When a new organization is created, all the default roles are automatically created for it.

200.description: Returns the newly created Organization object with the default access settings.

get.description: Gets settings for the currently authenticated user.

200.description: Returns a User object representing the currently logged on user (caller of this API method). The password field is always returned empty for security reasons.

patch.description:
Updates settings for the currently authenticated user.
Only 'timezone' and 'session_timeout' settings are currently updatable.

200.description: Returns the updated User object with an empty password field.

get.description:
**Requires permissions: `view_endpoints`, `view_software_repository`, `view_reports`**

Searches for Action1 objects that contain a phrase specified in the 'query' parameter in one of their fields. The search returns up to 10 objects within the specified organization.

200.description: Returns an enveloped JSON array of matching objects. The objects returned are not complete objects (most fields omitted). Query these objects individually for more details.

get.description: Retrieves information if any endpoints were added to an organization.

200.description: Returns 'Yes' if the user has already deployed endpoints in this organization. Returns 'No' if there are no endpoints in the organization.

get.summary: Getting the URL for agent installation
get.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoints`**

In order to manage an endpoint, the Action1 agent needs to be installed on it first. Agent binary files are specific to each organization. Use this call to obtain a URL to download the agent installation file for a specific organization and agent type.

200.description: Returns the Agent object with the publicly accessible URL for the agent binary file for a specified organization.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_endpoints`**

Lists all endpoints within the organization. Use filters to narrow down returned results.

**Requires permission: `view_endpoints`**

Obtains current information about the endpoint with the specified ID.

200.description: Returns the Endpoint object.

patch.summary: Changing an endpoint comment or name
patch.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoint_attributes`**

Changes the user-defined 'comment', 'name' and custom attributes for the specified endpoint.

custom:{Custom Attribute Name}.description: New value for custom attribute. The attribute name must be defined in the Advanced Settings.

200.description: Returns the Endpoint object.

delete.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoints`**

Removes a specified endpoint and attempts to uninstall its agent.

post.summary: Moving the endpoint to another organization
post.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoints`**

Moves the endpoint to another organization.

target_organization_id.description: The organization where the endpoint will be moved to.

200.description: Returns the Endpoint object.

get.summary: Getting missing updates for an endpoint
get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_endpoints`**

Obtains a list of missing software updates for a specific endpoint. Use filters to narrow down the returned results.

200.description: Returns the ResultPage with the SoftwareRepositoryPackage objects and paging. Each package version is located in a separate SoftwareRepositoryPackage object. Etag and Last-Modified may be included in the response.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_endpoints`**

Lists existing endpoint groups. Use filters and narrow down and sort the returned results.

200.description: Returns the ResultPage object with an array of Endpoint Groups with paging.Etag and Last-Modified may be included in the response.

post.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoints`**

Creates a new endpoint group within the specified organization. ('include_filter':[…] and 'exclude_filter':[…] -- can be omitted upon creation.)

200.description: Returns the newly created EndpointGroup object.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_endpoints`**

Gets a specific endpoint group by its ID.

200.description: Returns the EndpointGroup object.

patch.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoints`**

Changes settings for an existing endpoint group in the specified organization. If
certain fields are not specified in the object you submit, they won't get changed. I.e., you can just change the group name without changing the group filters.

200.description: Returns the updated EndpointGroup object.

delete.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoints`**

Deletes an existing group in the specified organization.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_endpoints`**

Lists all endpoints included in the specified group. Use parameters to filter the returned results.

200.description: Returns the ResultPage object with an array of Endpoint objects with paging. Etag and Last-Modified may be included in the response. Each returned Endpoint object will contain the 'added_via' attribute indicating how it came to this group (via manual addition or automatically via filters).

post.summary: Manually removing or adding endpoints to the group.
post.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoints`**

Joins endpoints with specified IDs or names to the endpoint group.

Removes endpoints with specific IDs.

If the specified endpoint is already in the group via filters, its 'added_via' attribute will be updated to 'manual' (from 'criteria') and the call will succeed.

200.description: Returns Success in case the method went through, however if one or more endpoint names or IDs could not be found, the user_message will contain a value different than "Success", indicating this result. The "details" will contain a JSON array with endpoint names or IDs that could not be found.

post.description:
**Requires permission: `remote_connect`**

Sends a request to the endpoint to start a new remote session.

After requesting to open a remote session, use 'GET /endpoints/managed/{orgId}/{endpointId}/remote_sessions/{sessionId}' again until 'connected' = 'yes'.

200.description: Returns a newly created RemoteSession object.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `remote_connect`**

Gets details for an existing remote session specified by ID.

200.description: Returns the RemoteSession object.

patch.description:
**Requires permission: `remote_connect`**

Changes the 'current_monitor' parameter for a specific remote session.

200.description: Returns the Updated RemoteSession object.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoints`**

Obtains the current Agent Deployment settings in a specified organization. If 'orgId' is to 'all', the call will fail.

200.description: Returns the AgentDeployment object with the Agent Deployment settings.

patch.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoints`**

Updates the Agent Deployment configuration for a specific organization.

200.description: Returns the updated AgentDeployment object with Agent Deployment settings.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoints`**

Lists all Action1 Deployer services in the specified organization. Use parameters to filter returned results.

200.description: Returns the ResultPage object with an array of objects with paging. Etag and Last-Modified may be included in the response.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoints`**

Obtains an URL to download the Deployer installation file. The Action1 Deployer installation files are specific to each organization. The Deployer services currently run on Windows only.

200.description: Returns the Deployer binary for the specified organization (Content-Type: application/octet-stream).

get.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoints`**

Obtains the current information about the specified Action1 Deployer service.

200.description: Returns the Deployer object with Action1 Deployer information.

delete.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_endpoints`**

In rare cases it is impossible to uninstall the Action1 Deployer (a computer it was deployed on was removed from the organization, OS reinstalled, etc.).

Use this call to delete the Deployer object without uninstalling the service.

Fails if the Deployer status is not 'Pending Install' (you must try to uninstall the Deployer first via POST '/API/endpoints/deployers/{org-id}/{deployer-id}/uninstall)''.

get.description:
**Requires one of the following permissions: `manage_data_sources`, `manage_reports`**

Gets a list of existing data sources. To filter out built-in data sources, set the 'builtin' parameter to 'yes'. For custom, set 'builtin' to 'no'.

200.description: Returns the ResultPage with an array of DataSource objects.

post.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_data_sources`**

Creates a new custom data source. At this time, all data sources are enterprise-wide.

200.description: Returns a newly created DataSource object.

get.description:
**Requires one of the following permissions: `manage_data_sources`, `manage_reports`**

Gets details about a specific data source. At this time, all data sources are enterprise-wide. The 'orgId' has to be set to 'all'.

200.description: Returns the DataSource object.

patch.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_data_sources`**

Updates a custom data source specified by its ID. At this time, all data sources are enterprise-wide. The 'orgId' has to be set to 'all'.

200.description: Returns an updated DataSource object.

delete.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_data_sources`**

Deletes an existing custom data source.

Note that you cannot remove built-in data sources.

At this time, all data sources are enterprise-wide. The 'orgId' has to be set to 'all'.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `use_scripts`**

Gets a list of existing scripts from the Script Library. To filter out built-in scripts, set the 'builtin' parameter to 'yes'. For custom, set 'builtin' to 'no'.

At this time, all scripts are enterprise-wide. The 'orgId' has to be set to 'all'.

200.description: Returns the ResultPage with an array of Script objects.

post.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_scripts`**

Creates a new custom script and adds it to the Script Library.

At this time, all scripts are enterprise-wide, The 'orgId' shall be set to 'all'. In the future, the organization-specific scripts will be supported.

The 'params' array (script parameters) included in the returned object is a read-only collection that is derived from the script text.

200.description: Returns the newly created Script object.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `use_scripts`**

Gets details for a script specified by its ID.

At this time, all scripts are enterprise-wide.

200.description: Returns the Script object.

patch.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_scripts`**

Updates details for an existing custom script specified by its ID.

At this time, all scripts are enterprise-wide.

The 'params' array (script parameters) included in the returned object is a read-only collection that is derived from the script text.

200.description: Returns the updated Script object.

delete.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_scripts`**

Deletes an existing custom script specified by its ID.

At this time, all scripts are enterprise-wide.

get.description:
Gets a list of existing setting templates. Setting templates are maintained by Action1 and cannot be modified.

At this time, all setting templates are enterprise-wide, even when applied to a specific organization only.

200.description: Returns the ResultPage with an array of SettingTemplate objects.

get.description:
Gets details about a setting template specified by its ID. Setting templates are maintained by Action1 and cannot be modified.

At this time, all setting templates are enterprise-wide.

200.description: Returns the SettingTemplate object.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_advanced_settings`**

Lists all existing settings.

At this time, all settings are enterprise-wide.

200.description: Returns the ResultPage with an array of Setting objects.

post.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_advanced_settings`**

Creates a new setting.

At this time, all setting templates are enterprise-wide.

200.description: Returns a newly created Setting object.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_advanced_settings`**

Gets details about the setting configuration.

At this time, all settings are enterprise-wide, but the scope of application can be limited to per organization or group.

200.description: Returns the Setting object.

patch.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_advanced_settings`**

Updates an existing setting specified by its ID.

At this time, all settings are enterprise-wide.

200.description: Updated Setting object.

delete.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_advanced_settings`**

Deletes an existing setting specified by its ID.

At this time, all settings are enterprise-wide.

get.description:
Gets a list of existing reports.

At this time all reports are enterprise-wide.

200.description: Returns a ResultPage with an array of Category and/or Report objects (no paging).

get.description:
Gets a list of reports and categories.

At this time all reports are enterprise-wide.

200.description: Returns list of current category and children categories and reports.

post.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_reports`**

Creates a custom report in the predefined Custom report category. You cannot create custom reports in other categories.

Custom reports are based on the data source. To learn more about data sources, see '/data-sources/*' calls.

Custom reports are enterprise-wide.

200.description: Returns a newly created Report object.

patch.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_reports`**

Updates a custom report. You cannot changes a custom report's category.

Custom reports are enterprise-wide.

200.description: Returns the updated Report object.

delete.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_reports`**

Deletes a custom report specified by its ID.

You cannot delete built-in reports.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_reports`**

Gets data organized by report rows. Use parameters to filter out returned results.

200.description: Returns the ResultPage with an array of ReportRow objects.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_reports`**

Returns report errors for the specified report. Use parameters to filter out returned results. For example, retrieve errors starting from error number 50, filtered by a search term 'powershell', sorted by a description in ascending order.

Note that to determine if any errors occurred during report generation, use ResultPage.total_errors property from the Report Data ResultPage.

200.description: Returns the ResultPage object with an array or ReportError objects and paging information.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_reports`**

Exports data from the report. Use parameters to filter out exported data.

The supported formats are 'csv' and 'html'.

post.description:
**Requires permission: `view_reports`**

This API method initiates an asynchronous update ("requery") of the report's underlying data source across all managed endpoints.

When the method returns a successful status (200), it indicates that the requery request has been placed in the queue. However, this does not guarantee that the endpoints have received or processed it. Do not call it too frequently as this will put an extra CPU load on your endpoints (depending on the complexity of the report's data source).
Endpoints that are currently connected will begin the requery process almost immediately, typically within a few seconds. Should any endpoints be disconnected or turned off when the request is made, they will process it once they are back online.
To verify the current status of a data row, refer to the "response_type" attribute within the ReportRow object, which can be retrieved using /reportdata . The object structure is as follows:

```
{
  "type": "ReportRow",
  "response_type": "cache/live"
  ...
}
```

A "response_type" value of "live" indicates that the data is current and reflects the results of the most recent requery request. Conversely, a "response_type" of "cache" suggests that the endpoint has yet to update its data to reflect the latest request.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_reports`**

Expands report details to provide more information. Use parameters to filter out returned results.

200.description: Returns the ResultPage object with an array or ReportRow objects and paging information.

parameters.name: reportRowId
parameters.description: Provide a specific report row ID.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_reports`**

Exports reports data. Use parameters to filter out exported data.

The supported formats are 'csv' and 'html'.

**Requires permission: `view_software_repository`**

Gets a list of Software Repository packages for the entire enterprise. Use parameters to filter out packages in the returned results.

200.description: Returns a ResultPage object with an enveloped JSON array of SoftwareRepositoryPackage objects and paging. Etag and Last-Modified may be included in the response.

post.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_software_repository`**

Create a new custom Software Repository package object (with no versions) and set its initial basic properties. To create package versions, use POST /software-repository/{orgId}/{packageId}/versions method.

200.description: Returns a newly created SoftwareRepositoryPackage object.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_software_repository`**

Gets details for a Software Repository package specified by its ID. Set the "fields" parameter to "*" or "versions" to include the non-default "versions" container of children objects. Example: /software-repository/{orgId}/{Adobe_Adobe_Acrobat_Reader_DC_1570155380192_builtin}?fields=*

200.description: Requested SoftwareRepositoryPackage object.

patch.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_software_repository`**

Modifies one or more properties of a custom Software Repository package, including contents of the child "version" objects.

Built-in packages cannot be modified except for 'EULA_accepted' setting. This method will return an error if you attempt to send a PATCH request for a built-in package and specify any properties except for 'EULA_accepted'.

The 'version.additional_actions.name' property shall always be present if the parameters of an additional action are to be modified. To change the 'name' parameter of an additional action, the action needs to be deleted (DELETE method) and then added back with the new name (PATCH request).

200.description: Returns an updated SoftwareRepositoryPackage object.

delete.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_software_repository`**

Deletes a custom Software Repository package specified by its ID.

Built-in Software Repository packages cannot be deleted. This API will return an error if you attempt to send a DELETE request for a built-in package.

post.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_software_repository`**

Creates a full copy of an existing Software Repository package under a new package ID. For example, use this call if you want to modify version settings for a built-in package. Note that Action1 does not maintain cloned built-in packages.

200.description: Returns a newly cloned SoftwareRepositoryPackage object.

post.summary: Create new version in Software Repository package
post.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_software_repository`**

Adds a new version to the specified Software Repository package.

Versions for built-in packages can be modified only if the caller has a special "Contributor" or "Admin" role assigned only to designated Action1 security team employees.

200.description: Returns a SoftwareRepositoryPackage object with a newly created Version sub-object.

get.summary: Get version in Software Repository package
get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_software_repository`**

Gets details about a package version specified by its ID.

200.description: Returns a Version object.

patch.summary: Modify version in Software Repository package
patch.description:
**Requires permissions:** 
- `accept_eula` - for "*EULA_accepted*" property

- `approve_updates` - for "*approval_status*" property

- `manage_software_repository` - for all other properties

Modifies settings of the specified version in the specified package.

Versions for built-in packages cannot be modified. This API will return an error if you attempt to send this PATCH request for a built-in package.

200.description: The updated SoftwareRepositoryPackage Version object.

delete.summary: Delete version from Software Repository package
delete.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_software_repository`**

Deletes the specified version of the specified custom Software Repository package.

Versions of built-in packages cannot be deleted. This API will return an error if you attempt to send a DELETE request for a version of a built-in package.

delete.summary: Delete additional action from version of Software Repository package
delete.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_software_repository`**

Deletes the specified additional action from the specified custom package.

Additional actions configured for the versions of the built-in packages cannot be modified. This API will return an error if you attempt to send a DELETE request for a built-in package.

get.summary: Check for Software Repository package matching conflicts before creating a new package version
get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_software_repository`**

Checks Installed Apps for conflicts before a Software Repository new package with its initial version is created (the package does not exist yet).

When a new package version is created or edited, the new "app_name_match" value of the "version" object shall not conflict with the values of "app_name_match" of already created packages/versions (e.g., two different versions of two different packages should not match the same installed software). Conflicts arise if the same "app_name_match" is found for the package version in the Installed Apps.

200.description: Returns packages/versions which are conflicting with the new/edited version.

get.summary: Check for package matching conflicts when editing and existing package version
get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_software_repository`**

Checks Installed Apps for conflicts when updating an existing package or its version.

When a new package version is created or edited, the new "app_name_match" value of the "version" object shall not conflict with the values of "app_name_match" of already created packages/versions (e.g., two different versions of two different packages should not match the same installed software). Conflicts arise if the same "app_name_match" is found for the package version in the Installed Apps.

200.description: Returns packages/versions which are conflicting with the new/edited version.

post.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_software_repository`**

Initializes package file upload.

The client starts by sending the initial upload request.

The server returns 308 Resume Incomplete status code upon success with the Location header containing the unique upload ID, which expires within 24 hours and it has to be used in subsequent upload requests.

parameters.name: X-Upload-Content-Length
parameters.description: The total size of the file to be uploaded.

308.description: Returns the Location header containing the unique upload ID.

X-Upload-Location.description: The URL for uploading package file chunks, which contains the 'upload_id'.

put.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_software_repository`**

Uploads package file chunks. 

After the upload initialization request has been made, the client then issues a series of chunk upload requests.      

The size of each chunk must be at least 5Mb and all the chunks must have the same size **(except the last one)**.

parameters.name: Content-Range
parameters.description: Content-Range value. In this example, we are sending the first 500k bytes of 2000k total.

parameters.name: Content-Length
parameters.description: Number of bytes in the current chunk.

200.description: All chunks have been successfully uploaded.

308.description: The chunk has been successfully uploaded, but you need to continue making this request to upload the remaining chunks.

Range.description: Indicates how many bytes were transferred.

500.description:
Server error.
If client receives any 5xx errors upon sending of any upload chunks, it needs to resume the interrupted upload using the following PUT request with empty payload: ``` PUT /API/software-repository/{orgId}/{package-id}/{version-id}/upload?platform=Windows_32&upload_id=:UPLOAD_ID HTTP/1.1 Content-Length: 0 Content-Range: bytes */2000000 # this requests the current status from the server ``` The server responds with this: ``` HTTP/1.1 308 Resume Incomplete Content-Length: 0 Range: bytes=0-199000 # this indicates that the first 200000 bytes were transferred ``` The client can then proceed from the starting position 200000 indicated by the server in the above example using PUT requests.
**Note:** the client should use an exponential backoff strategy if any server errors are returned when resuming or retrying upload requests. These errors can occur if a server is getting overloaded. Exponential backoff can help alleviate these kinds of problems when there is a high volume of requests or heavy network traffic. The only exception is error 404 (File Not Found), which means that the upload session has expired and the upload needs to be reinitiated from scratch to obtain a new upload ID.

**Requires permission: `view_installed_software`**

Gets a list of installed apps. Use parameters to filter out apps in the returned results.

200.description: Returns a ResultPage object with an array of ReportRow objects and paging.

post.description:
**Requires permission: `view_installed_software`**

This API method initiates an asynchronous update ("requery") of the installed software inventory across all managed endpoints.

Note that installed software inventory is updated automatically every 15 minutes or less if any changes to software are detected.  Additionally, when software is installed or uninstalled with Action1, the inventory is updated immediately. Use this method only if you need the most current real-time data or when software was installed or uninstalled without Action1 and you don't want to wait 15 minutes. Do not call it too frequently as this will put an extra CPU load on your endpoints.

When the method returns a successful status (200), it indicates that the requery request has been placed in the queue. However, this does not guarantee that the endpoints have received or processed it. Endpoints that are currently connected will begin the requery process almost immediately, typically within a few seconds. Should any endpoints be disconnected or turned off when the request is made, they will process it once they are back online.
To verify the current status of a data row referring to an installed application, refer to the "response_type" attribute within the ReportRow object, which can be retrieved using '/installed-software/{orgId}/data'. The object structure is as follows:

```
{
  "type": "ReportRow",
  "response_type": "cache/live"
  ...
}
```

A "response_type" value of "live" indicates that the data is current and reflects the results of the most recent requery request. Conversely, a "response_type" of "cache" suggests that the endpoint has yet to update its data to reflect the latest request.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_installed_software`**

Returns apps report errors. Use parameters to filter out returned results. For example, retrieve errors starting from error number 50, filtered by a search term 'powershell', sorted by a description in ascending order.

post.summary: Re-querying installed apps on a specific endpoint

**Requires one of the following permissions: `view_installed_software`, `view_endpoints`**

This API method initiates an asynchronous update ("requery") of the installed software inventory for the specified endpoint.

Note that installed software inventory is updated automatically every 15 minutes or less if any changes to software are detected.  Additionally, when software is installed or uninstalled with Action1, the inventory is updated immediately. Use this method only if you need the most current real-time data or when software was installed or uninstalled without Action1 and you don't want to wait 15 minutes. Do not call it too frequently as this will put an extra CPU load on your endpoints.

When the method returns a successful status (200), it indicates that the requery request has been placed in the queue. However, this does not guarantee that the endpoints have received or processed it. Endpoint that are currently connected will begin the requery process almost immediately, typically within a few seconds. Should endpoint be disconnected or turned off when the request is made, they will process it once they are back online.
To verify the current status of a data row referring to an installed application, refer to the "response_type" attribute within the ReportRow object, which can be retrieved using '/installed-software/{orgId}/data'. The object structure is as follows:

```
{
  "type": "ReportRow",
  "response_type": "cache/live"
  ...
}
```

A "response_type" value of "live" indicates that the data is current and reflects the results of the most recent requery request. Conversely, a "response_type" of "cache" suggests that the endpoint has yet to update its data to reflect the latest request.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_vulnerabilities`**

Retrieves a comprehensive list of all vulnerable software installed on the organization's managed endpoints. 

This includes information about the specific vulnerabilities, affected versions, and affected endpoints. The data provides insights into potential risks, enabling targeted remediation efforts.

The method identifies the locations of the vulnerable software, enabling targeted analysis and action for the particular security concern.

200.description: Returns a ResultPageAbridged object containing an array of VulnerableEndpoint objects with paging.

get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_vulnerabilities`**

Retrieves detailed information about a specific vulnerability as it exists in the context of a specific organization, including the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) details such as the CVSS score, attack vector, severity, and other relevant attributes. 

This information provides a comprehensive overview of the vulnerability, aiding in understanding its nature and potential impact.

200.description: Returns a CveDescription object who contains CVE details.

get.summary: Detailed information on a specific vulnerability in general (not for an organization), including CVE details like attack vector.

**Requires permission: `view_vulnerabilities`**

Retrieves detailed information about a specific vulnerability in general, not within a context of any organization. 

This includes the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) details such as the CVSS score, attack vector, severity, and other relevant attributes. 

This information provides a comprehensive overview of the vulnerability, aiding in understanding its nature and potential impact.

200.description: Returns a CveDescription object containing CVE details.

get.summary: Lists past remediation actions for a specific vulnerability
get.description:
**Requires permission: `view_vulnerabilities`**

Retrieves a list of previously applied remediation actions for a specific vulnerability in a specific organization. 

This includes details such as the type of action taken, the date of application, and the current status of the remediation. 

The method provides a historical view of the measures implemented to address the vulnerability, supporting ongoing management and compliance monitoring.

200.description: Returns a ResultPageAbridged object containing an array of Remediation objects with paging.

post.summary: Documents applied compensating controls for a specific vulnerability.
post.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_vulnerabilities`**

Adds documentation for an applied remediation action for specific vulnerability. 
At this time, the only type of action that can be documented is application of compensating controls. 

This method allows to record details of the compensatory measures taken, including the nature of the controls, the date of application, and the rationale for the choice. 
The information enhances transparency and accountability in the vulnerability management process.

200.description: Returns the newly created Remediation object.

patch.summary: Updates record of compensating controls when remediation changes
patch.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_vulnerabilities`**

Updates an existing remediation record for compensating controls for a vulnerability. 

This method allows for modifications to reflect changes in the applied remediation actions, such as adjustments to the nature of the controls, or reasons for the changes. It ensures that the documentation remains accurate and current with the ongoing vulnerability management process. Only 'comment' field can be updated.

200.description: Returns the updated Remediation object.

delete.description:
**Requires permission: `manage_vulnerabilities`**

Deletes a specific remediation record for compensating controls for a specific vulnerability. 

This method removes the details of an applied remediation action, including all related information about the nature of the controls, and the rationale for the choice.

user_id.description: The ID of the user associated with the event.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the event in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD_HH-MM-SS

status_message.description: The status of the operation. Examples: OK, Unauthorized, Forbidden, Not Found, Internal Server Error.

last_seen.description: The Action1 Deployer last connected date in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD_HH-mm-ss.

name.description: The name of computer where Deployer is installed.

external_address.description: The agent address from the socket. In most cases, it is the public address of the agent network.

platform.description: The platform of the Action1 Deployer.

version.description: The version of the Action1 Deployer.

install_date.description: The Action1 Deployer install date in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD_HH-mm-ss.

cve_id.description: A unique identifier assigned to a specific vulnerability.

published_date.description: The date when this vulnerability was published in the vulnerability sources (such as NIST NVD)

base_severity.description: A standard metric used to evaluate the severity level of this security vulnerability identified in the vulnerability source.

cvss_score.description: A numerical value with one decimal point that represents the severity of this software vulnerability. Ranges from from 0.0 to 10.0.

description.description: A textual description of the vulnerability's nature, potential risks, and recommended mitigation strategies.
description.example: Directory traversal vulnerability in the (1) extract and (2) extractall functions in the tarfile module in Python allows user-assisted remote attackers to overwrite arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) sequence in filenames in a TAR archive, a related issue to CVE-2001-1267.

availability_impact.description: An assessment of the extent to which an attacker could disrupt or degrade the normal functioning of a system, resulting in service unavailability or downtime.

confidentiality_impact.description: An assessment of the impact to the confidentiality of the information resources managed by a software component.

integrity_impact.description: An assessment of the extent to which an attacker can modify, alter, or tamper with critical information or system components, leading to data corruption, unauthorized modifications, or system instability.

vector_string.description: A standardized representation of the characteristics and attributes of this vulnerability, such as if it could be exploited remotely or requires elevated privileges.

exploitability_score.description: A numerical value of the likelihood that an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to disrupt or degrade a system's normal functioning, potentially causing service unavailability or downtime.

impact_score.description: A numerical value of the extent to which an attacker could disrupt or degrade the normal functioning of a system, resulting in service unavailability or downtime, considering the potential impact of a vulnerability.

attack_complexity.description: An assessment of the level of difficulty or complexity an attacker would encounter to exploit this vulnerability. Note: Applicable to CVSS 3.0 and CVSS 3.1.

attack_vector.description: An assessment of the path or means through which an attacker could exploit this vulnerability. Note:: Applicable to CVSS 3.0 and CVSS 3.1.

privileges_required.description: An assessment of the level of privileges or access an attacker needs to exploit this vulnerability. Note: applicable to CVSS 3.0 and CVSS 3.1.

scope.description: An assessment of whether this vulnerability in one vulnerable component has an impact on resources in components beyond its security scope. Note: Applicable to CVSS 3.0 and CVSS 3.1.

user_interaction.description: An assessment of whether the vulnerability can be exploited solely by the attacker or if a separate user (other than the attacker) needs to participate in some manner to compromise the vulnerable component. Note: Applicable to CVSS 3.0 and CVSS 3.1.

access_complexity.description: The level of complexity or effort required for an attacker to gain access to a vulnerable system to exploit this vulnerability. Note: Applicable to CVSS 2.0.

access_vector.description: An assessment of the network location or context that an attacker needs to be in to initiate an attack. Note: Applicable to CVSS 2.0.

authentication.description: The level of authentication required for an attacker to exploit this vulnerability or gain unauthorized access to a system. Note: Applicable to CVSS 2.0.

cisa_kev.description: Indicates whether this software vulnerability is listed in the CISA KEV Catalog (Known Exploited Vulnerabilities) because it is known to be actively exploited.

cisa_known_ransomware_campaign_use.description: Indicates whether this vulnerability is known to have been exploited in ransomware campaigns.

IDs of endpoints and/or groups to run this batch on.

### Examples:

`{ id: {endpoint-id}, type: 'Endpoint' }` - IDs of endpoints to apply this automation to.

----

`{ id: {enpoint-group-id}, type: 'EndpointGroup'}` - IDs of groups to apply this automation to.

----

----

settings_timezone.description:
The time zone for automation execution:

- UTC - the automation will execute at the same time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
- LOCALTIME - the automation will execute based on the local time of each endpoint.

settings.description:
### Available schedule settings:

- ONCE – apply only once on a specified DATE and AT a specified time.

- EVERY:m – apply every M minutes, first apply on specified DATE and AT parameters.

- WEEKLY:weekday1,weekday2,… – apply AT a specified time on certain weekdays of every week (weekdays: Sun,Mon,Tue,Wed,Thu,Fri,Sat). The DATE parameter is ignored and uses the schedule's last saved date as a starting date.

- MONTHLY:d – apply on a specified day 'd' (range: 1-31) of every month AT a specified time. The DATE parameter is ignored and uses the schedule's last saved date as a starting date.

- MONTHLYWEEK:weeknum:weekday – apply AT a specified time on a weekday or certain week number, such as '2:Mon' means the second Monday of every month (weekdays: Sun,Mon,Tue,Wed,Thu,Fri,Sat). Similar to MONTHLY, this setting ignores DATE and bases it on the last saved date.

- DATE:YYYY-MM-DD - the date to apply, must be specified for ONCE and EVERY, ignored for MONTHLY, WEEKLY, and MONTHLYWEEK.

- AT:HH-MM-SS - the time to apply, must be specified unless the schedule is DISABLED.

### Examples:

`ENABLED EVERY:60 AT:09:00:00 DATE:2021-06-19` – apply every 60 minutes, first starting on June 19, 2021 at 09am

----

`ENABLED ONCE AT:17-13-00 DATE:2019-01-15` – apply once on Jan 15, 2019 at 5:13pm

----

`ENABLED MONTHLY:5 AT:07-47-00` - scheduled to apply on the 5th of every month at 7:47am

----

`DISABLED WEEKLY:Mon,Tue,Fri AT:07-00-00` - not scheduled, but apply run every Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 7am if enabled.

----

`ENABLED MONTHLYWEEK:2:Mon AT:07-47-00` – apply on the second Monday of every month at 7:47am

----

`DISABLED` – not scheduled yet

----

items.name: Viewer
items.description: View all information within selected organizations, including reports, action history, policies and settings. Includes the ability to create alerts and scheduled reports.

items.name: Manager
items.description: Includes everything that Viewer role has, plus the ability to change configuration settings within managed organizations, except for assigning access roles.

items.name: Organization Admin
items.description: Includes everything that Manager role has, plus the ability to assign roles to existing users. Since organization admins can browse all users in the entire enterprise, do not grant this role to users who must be isolated from other organizations (such as in MSP environments).

items.name: Enterprise Admin
items.description: Includes everything that Organization Admin role has, plus the ability to create and delete organizations, create and delete users, and manage access to all organizations in the enterprise.
